sub_title: Multicultural Brand Strategist & Multilingual Digital Marketing Specialist 🏳️‍🌈LGBT Entrepreneurs & Entrepreneurs of Color Should Take up Space. I help w/ Marketing Strategies & Implementation💥 Co-founder BENELUX GLCC
summary:
Be the next queer icon in your industry! I can help you get there, all you have to do is hit me up at 
🏳️‍🌈 MARKETINGBYROCIO.COM 🏳️‍🌈

I am a multicultural brand strategist and multilingual digital marketing expert who helps queer entrepreneurs and entrepreneurs of color take up space in the fashion industry––and beyond! 💥

When we – as LGBTQ+ people and people of color – have historically been excluded from resources for building up our businesses, it makes sense that queer business owners feel ill-equipped to handle the current professional landscape.

Whether it’s not understanding the platforms to use or audience to target as a queer fashion brand, or gaining confidence as a queer freelancer, there is more than enough space for you. 

I come in with expert digital marketing and branding expertise for the fashion industry, leading you and your team to better understand the landscape you’re dealing with, while also providing essential resources and tools to help you gain confidence in the world.

🤔 With my multicultural and multilingual background and my lived experience as a non-binary bisexual person, I use marketing to superpower people like me to thrive in business. 

Now is the time to take up space. Not sure how? Send me a message or make your way to my website to book a call.

💡 https://marketingbyrocio.com/ 💡

🎯 SERVICES 🎯

🌈 LINKEDIN COACHING FOR PERSONAL BRANDING & BIZ PAGES
🌈 SPEAKING & WORKSHOP FACILITATION FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
🌈 AGENCY-LEVEL BRAND, WEBSITE, & CONTENT STRATEGY AND MANAGEMENT

From working in marketing in New York City to studying the fashion industry in Paris, from growing up part-time in the Dominican Republic to building my business in the Netherlands, and back to New York City, I’m determined to keep traveling and learning languages to expand my network of awesome LGBTQ+ creatives, entrepreneurs, and humans. This is the way I intend to contribute to my communities which have sacrificed so much, just so that you and I could be here and make more change.

More about me:
 
🤝 Co-founder of the BGLBC - BeNeLux (Belgium, Netherlands, & Luxembourg) LGBTIQ+ Business Chamber
 🌈 Double-certified LGBTQ+ Business Enterprise® by the NGLCC USA and the BGLBC
🌏 Polyglot globetrotter (five languages and counting; eight countries and counting)
👨🏽‍💻 Avid e-learner; MA+BS holder, but I'm not stopping there  👀 MBA next? 
🧘🏽‍♀️ Daily mindful meditation since September 2019
📍 Amsterdam-based, 99% remote-working
♍️ Virgo (if you couldn't already tell)
🗽 NYC born and raised
🇩🇴 Proud Dominican

treasury_media.title: My Website & Social Media Links
treasury_media.description:
LinkedIn is where I make my most valuable connections, but I still spend time on Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, and other social media. Why not connect with me there?

Because as a digital marketing strategist, I need to know which platform is best for my potential and current clientele. For that, I need to be on ALL the platforms, studying their algorithms and content trends to make informed decisions. Check out my profiles and let me know what you think!

school.name: Frank Sinatra High School of the Performing Arts
Institut d'Enseignement Supérieur d'Informatique et de Gestion

awards.title: Parsons Paris Student Research Grant
awards.description: Recipient of the Student Research Grant at Parsons Paris, funding research trips to San Francisco and Chicago where I visited the GLBT Historical Society Museum & Archives and Leather Archives & Museum, respectively. This funding allowed me to begin my research for my second year graduate thesis: What is LGBT fashion in the museum and the archive? In visiting these institutions, I gained insight on geographical contexts that create differences in individual institutions with regards to the LGBT community and its fashion expressions.

projects.title: ChelseaRides Digital Marketing Project
projects.description: For an assignment given to me in a Digital Marketing course, I had to create a website mock-up for a local shop in New York City. I created this website alongside a brand marketing plan complete with SWOT audit, target demographics, competitor research, and a SEO and content marketing strategy.

projects.title: LGBT Masterlist Project
projects.description: It started off as a 15-week project for Digital Marketing course taken in 2016. I compiled different forms of LGBT media into lists and published them on a near-weekly basis to a larger Tumblr audience. I used SEO tools and skills in order to improve search engine rankings. As of May 2020, all twelve masterlists have yielded 60,000 notes. By the end of the 3 month project period, the blog gained nearly 1,000 followers, and the blog is the first Google result for the keywords "LGBT Masterlists."

profile_positions.description:
Queerency is the leading source for LGBTQ+ business news. By covering awesome queer-owned brands and inspiring LGBTQ entrepreneurs, Queerency has taken up space and made space for others. 

I have worked closely with Travers Johnson on pilot programs such as their video marketing campaigns on TikTok. I was also the editor of the exclusive Guide to Fashion in which I interviewed leading LGBT business owners and creatives in the fashion industry.

I connect my network of LGBT owned fashion brands to report on the queer fashion economy, and offer one-to-one marketing consultation to the news media company.

As a member of the Queerency team, we seek to serve the tea on the queer economy with dignity and depth.  

We're building a world where LGBTQ+ people can be seen and heard in business media and our mission is simple: to offer possibility models for who queer people can be and what we can achieve.

We're a collective of diverse queer creators based in Austin, D.C., New York, Paris, and Amsterdam. Please reach out with ideas, questions, and especially if you have leads on:

💡 queer entrepreneurs and LGBTQ-owned businesses we should profile
💡 LGBTQ workers and creators we should highlight
💡 queer work, money, and economic issues we should cover
💡 partnership ideas and opportunities
profile_positions.title: Assistant Editor and Digital Marketing Consultant

profile_positions.description:
How are we supposed to survive in this world when there is so much rigged against us? Despite that, our community has survived for so long, because we are exactly that: a community. And what does a community do? It sustains itself. It shares resources. It lifts others and so the others whom we’ve lifted up can raise others as well. 

I chose to be a digital marketer who helps LGBT+ entrepreneurs and entrepreneurs of color because I knew I would be miserable working in the corporate environment, only allowed to do my activism after 5 pm if I wasn’t exhausted enough from the work that drains most of my days. 

Since realizing our potential as a queer community, I’ve worked with amazing companies that have seen me for whom I am and valued me for what I am worth. That transformation can happen to you too. From Queerency, a phenomenal news hub for all things queer business, housing me for a month to cover queer fashion, to the worldwide queer dating app HER which welcomed me for their affiliate marketing program – I have connected LGBT+ entrepreneurs together and spotlighted the history-makers, only scratching the surface of our community's potential in this field. 

I intend to share my knowledge and resources not only with my digital marketing skills, but also my speaking skills, which I have exercised at events such as TransTech and Lesbians Who Tech to Pride & Joy Summit. 

I could have never imagined facing my disillusionment with the world we live in by diving head first into a growing, robust community such as one of queer professionals, leaders, business owners, and so much more. 

Do you feel disillusioned with the world we live in and want to help others with your awesome product or service? Let me help you with an amazing brand strategy; let me tell you where you need to be, and guide your team on how to execute in a sustainable way. What do you say? Book a call! 

https://marketingbyrocio.com/
profile_positions.title: CEO and Digital Marketer

profile_positions.description:
HER is here to connect queer women, non-binary, trans, and gender non-conforming folks. HER wanted unique access to my network of LGBT+ creatives, entrepreneurs, and influencers as part of their pilot affiliate marketing program.

My responsibilities included:

🌈 Maintained and directly managed relationships with selected affiliates to understand their needs and priorities and drive their success within the program.
🌈 Contributed to weekly and monthly KPI reporting.
🌈 Constantly monitored performance across all media and territories, taking rapid, data-driven decisions to optimize performance.
🌈 Built strong working relationships with Brand Marketing, Consumer Digital Marketing and PR to develop integrated plans for key sales periods and opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Affiliate Marketing Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Part of the wholesale team during the AW19 sales campaign in Paris:

•	Translated negotiations between Spanish-speaking buyers and English- and French-speaking sellers and team members when it became clear I was the only Spanish speaker on the team
•	Ran errands and made phone calls for confirmation of logistics during the hectic market week
•	Merchandised the collection 
•	Managed the showroom
•	Maintained the samples 
•	Dressed and styled showroom models 
•	Assisted the wholesale team in administrative tasks, assisted press team
•	Supported the team with their appointments
profile_positions.title: Showroom Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Assisted with logistics of guests and technical aspects of graduate program events, exhibitions and programming with much independence due to program director's medical leave
•	Managed, wrote, and peer-reviewed entries for Fashion Studies graduate program blog to promote the program using SEO tools and best practices
•	Curated content for Fashion Studies graduate program Instagram profile
•	Photographed visits of guest speakers, visits to fashion trade shows and to museums
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research/Program Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Shadowed photographers during S/S 2019 Paris Fashion Week; attended the McQueen SS 2019 show and recorded my experience shadowing famed photographer Kim Weston Arnold
•	Interviewed photographers, editors, and InDigital production team about the process of creating and distributing a fashion digital image
•	In conjunction with my work as program assistant and with the rest of my graduate class, we organized an exhibition on our findings, Unmaking the Fashion Digital Image
profile_positions.title: Fashion Researcher, Writer, and Exhibition Curator

•	Managed office schedule for meetings between account executives and department store representatives and buyers
profile_positions.title: Showroom Receptionist

profile_positions.description:
•	Part of the Enterprise Loyalty Marketing team, managed email campaigns for 1-800-Flowers.com and their family of gourmet food brands (Harry & David, The Popcorn Factory, and more)
•	Provided support for Mother's Day enterprise sweepstakes campaign, "Moms Who WOW": planned logistics for promotion of sweeps onsite and in email campaigns, reviewed 2,000+ submissions, reported on landing page traffic, built relationships with influencers to promote the sweepstakes
•	Assisted in Google Ads campaigns setup
•	Trained interns on how to use Google Analytics and other methods to manage onsite promotions

volunteer_experiences.description: Climate Cardinals is an international nonprofit working to translate climate change research and information, making the climate movement more accessible to those who don’t speak English. I joined as a volunteer Spanish and French translator, to educate those who are unaware of climate change and provide them with information on how they can help combat the crisis.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer Contributor/SEO Consultant for Fashion History Timeline
volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Wrote academic essays for fashion history database by the Fashion Institute of Technology 
•	Provided digital marketing counsel (SEO best practices, etc.)
•	Edited essays for submission, corrected academic essays
Canvassed for political elections; phone banking; lobby day 2015
The ICPD Task Force seeks for freedom for all women across the world. I volunteered in 2015 at a seminar to help facilitate seating and organization of the event.
